title: The Silent Start
bug_fix: Fixes 'Loudest Voice Bias' and 'HiPPO' (Highest Paid Person's Opinion) effect.
trigger: Start of any strategic meeting (Product Review, Board Meeting).
script: We will now read the 6-page narrative in silence for 20 minutes. Please annotate your comments in the doc.
enactment: Total silence. No devices other than the reading device. Discussion begins only after everyone has closed the document.

title: Blameless Post-Mortem
bug_fix: Fixes 'Fear of Failure' and 'Silence Scripts' that hide errors.
trigger: A production outage or significant project failure.
script: We are here to investigate the process, not the person. Assume everyone did the best job they could with the information they had.
enactment: Create a timeline of events. Identify the 'Second Story' (what the engineer was seeing/thinking at the time).
source: Project Aristotle & The Field Guide to Understanding 'Human Error'

title: The Check-In Round
bug_fix: Fixes 'Cognitive Drift' where people are physically present but mentally absent.
script: What is one thing distracting you right now? Checking in.
enactment: Go around the circle. Each person speaks once. No cross-talk or therapy. Just state the distraction and say 'Checking in.'

title: The Shrek Ears
trigger: An engineer breaks the build or causes an outage.
script: Congratulations, you are now a real engineer.
enactment: The engineer wears a pair of green Shrek ears for the rest of the day. It is a badge of honor, signaling they pushed code that mattered.

title: Virtual Fika
trigger: 3:00 PM on Wednesdays (or automated via bot).
enactment: 15 minutes of coffee and cake. If anyone talks about a project, they must pay a penalty (e.g., sing a song).

title: The Pre-Mortem
trigger: Before signing off on a major project launch.
script: Imagine we are 6 months in the future and this project has failed spectacularly. Write down the story of why it failed.
enactment: Team spends 5 minutes writing the 'failure story.' Then they work backward to fix those risks today.
